content.raw:
The code coverage drop appears to be a bug in code coverage, so I think we can ignore that.

However, the Windows Jenkins Pipeline is currently failing with an [internal compiler error](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/sw_ignition/job/ignition_plugin-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/34/console), so that’s concerning. I’ll try to test this branch on a Windows machine.
content.html:
The code coverage drop appears to be a bug in code coverage, so I think we can ignore that.

However, the Windows Jenkins Pipeline is currently failing with an internal compiler error, so that’s concerning. I’ll try to test this branch on a Windows machine.

content.raw: I think it may be a hardware problem with our CI machine. I've started a slack thread to discuss buying a new machine. In the meantime, I think appveyor would be a good option for this repo since it is pretty low on the dependency chain, just needs cmake and dl. I'll see if it's fast and easy to set that up
content.html: I think it may be a hardware problem with our CI machine. I've started a slack thread to discuss buying a new machine. In the meantime, I think appveyor would be a good option for this repo since it is pretty low on the dependency chain, just needs cmake and dl. I'll see if it's fast and easy to set that up

content.raw:
It seems MSVC got confused by one of our template specializations. Luckily that specialization was only meant to help sanity check, so the solution here was just to remove it: 7a26bb0

This worked on my local Windows VM. We’ll see if appyveyor is happy with it.
content.html:
It seems MSVC got confused by one of our template specializations. Luckily that specialization was only meant to help sanity check, so the solution here was just to remove it: 7a26bb0

This worked on my local Windows VM. We’ll see if appyveyor is happy with it.

content.raw: can we now remove the `STATIC_ASSERT_plugin_no_args` test?

Yep, just did that when I realized that the pipelines failed: 5882aca

That test doesn’t get run on Windows, so I overlooked it before pushing.

content.raw: This line uses `_resolvedName`, while the doxygen uses `_pluginNameOrAlias`. Then next function uses `_pluginNameOrAlias` for both, but the function implementations all seem to use `_resolvedName`. It would be nice to clarify this.
content.html: This line uses _resolvedName, while the doxygen uses _pluginNameOrAlias. Then next function uses _pluginNameOrAlias for both, but the function implementations all seem to use _resolvedName. It would be nice to clarify this.
